parameters: GabText Did you really think I was going to lose?
GabText Pay your regrets in the afterlife
Do you wish to save your progress?
Do you wish to save your progress?

Welcome to the Battle Screen!
The game uses a \c[17]Turn Based Battle System\c[0].
Each battler acts immediately when their turn arrives.
\c[17]Turn Order\c[0] is determined by the battler's agility.
The Turn Order is displayed at the top right corner.\ndc<Battle Tutorial - Basics>
There are many stats you can use to sway the battle in your favor.
You can view the details of these stats in the \c[17]Help File\c[0], which is accessible through the main menu.
All tutorials shown will be available for viewing in the \c[17]Help File\c[0], so if you're ever confused, you'll likely find your answer there!
There are \c[17]3\c[0] main skill types in the game:

Magic
Each character has access to \c[17]2 of the 3\c[0] Skill Types.\ndc
The damage dealt is dependent on the user's \c[14]\i[570]Attack\c[0] stat and the target's \c[14]\i[571]Defense\c[0] stat.
The damage dealt is dependent on the user's \c[30]\i[572]Magic Attack\c[0] stat and the target's \c[30]\i[573]Magic Defense\c[0] stat.
\c[17]Special Skills\c[0] may deal either \c[14]Physical Damage\c[0] or \c[30]Magic Damage\c[0].
The damage dealt is dependent on the user's \c[14]\i[570]Attack\c[0] and \c[30]\i[572]Magic Attack\c[0]
stat and the target's \c[14]\i[571]Defense\c[0] and \c[30]\i[573]Magic Defense\c[0] stat.
Almost all skills have a \c[17]\i[540]Cooldown\c[0] assosciated with them.
When a skill is used, it goes on its designated cooldown. While on cooldown, the skill cannot be used
Stronger skills usually have longer cooldowns.\ndc<Battle Tutorial - Skill Cooldowns>
Some skills do not cost the character their turn to execute.
These skills have a \i[446] icon over them.
You may use as many \c[17]Instant Cast Skills\c[0] on your turn as necessary, though they do have cooldowns, and overusing them could very quickly drain your \c[1]MP\c[0].
Equipments are extremely important in order to gain an edge in battle.
Not only do they provide useful stats, but each equipment also has a \c[17]Passive\c[0] as well.
Sometimes, an equipment's passive may outweigh a deficiency in stats in certain situations, so customize wisely!
Details of these equip types can be viewed in the \c[17]Help File\c[0].\ndc<Battle Tutorial - Equipment>
\c[17]Status Effects\c[0] are special states applied to battlers.
They are crucial to taking advantage of the battle, and should be used wisely.
Although most Status Effects are unique to skills and enemies, certain
status effects are commonly used and assosciated with skills as a secondary effect.
These states are called \c[17]Ailments\c[0]. You can view more information on \c[17]Ailments\c[0] in the \c[17]Help File\c[0].
There are \c[17]8\c[0] different elements existing in the world.

Enemies may be resistant or weak to certain elements. You can use \c[17]\is[4]\c[0], which is a skill available to everyone, to identify and exploit these elemental weaknesses.\ndc<Battle Tutorial - Elements>
Skills of a certain element have the element's icon next to them, so you can easily identify the element of the skill.
\c[17]Leonardo\c[0] has access to Skill Types \c[17]Combat\c[0] and \c[17]Special\c[0].
He relies heavily on dealing as much damage as possible, and
possesses a very high \c[14]Attack\c[0] stat and a respectable \c[30]Magic Attack\c[0] stat.
You may have noticed the gauge on the bottom right corner of the battle screen.
That gauge is the \c[17]\i[630]Party Limit Gauge\c[0]! The gauge is shared with all members of the party, and it increases whenever the party \c[17]takes or deals\c[0] damage.
The gauge is carried over through battles, so you can use random encounters to build it up.
The gauge is required for various actions, such as...
\c[14]Break Skills\c[0] are extremely powerful skills that require the \c[17]\i[630]Party Limit Gauge\c[0] to use.
Although powerful, they may take up a huge portion of the gauge, so use them wisely!
More uses of the \c[17]\i[630]Party Limit Gauge\c[0] will be explained when they become available.
If you feel like certain equipment would be better for the current
battle, you can change your equipment mid-battle through the

You can only change equipment once per turn for each character, and consumes \c[17]a quarter of one limit gauge\c[0], so if you do decide to change equipment mid-battle, make sure you make a sound decision!\ndc<Battle Tutorial - Equipment>

Each enemy is categorised into one or multiple \c[17]classes\c[0]:
\ndc
\c[0]You can view an enemy's class by \c[17]Scanning\c[0] them.\ndc<Battle Tutorial - Enemy Types>
Your character's \c[17]Capability\c[0] stat towards each type determines your proficiency against each enemy class.
The \c[17]higher your Capability vs a certain enemy class\c[0], the \c[17]more damage you deal to that enemy class\c[0] and the \c[17]less damage you take from that enemy class\c[0].
Your character's capability towards each enemy class can be viewed in the \c[17]Status\c[0] screen of the Main Menu, along with other stats.
As already stated before, every equipment has a \c[14]passive\c[0] assosciated with it.
Characters can \c[17]master\c[0] the passives of each equipment as well!
If a character masters a passive, they acquire the passive \c[14]permanently\c[0] and no longer require the equipment to be equipped in order
If a character wears an equipment with a passive they have already mastered, the passive bonus is \c[17]doubled\c[0].
Also note that \c[17]not all passives can be mastered\c[0].
Equipment that your characters have mastered will have a \i[15] icon on them in the equip screen for quick reference.
As your character participates in battles, they will acquire \c[1]Skill Points (SP)\c[0]
The SP is awarded to each equipment that the character has equipped.
SP is earned per action and per enemy kill.
\c[18]Reserve party members do not gain SP\c[0].
Once your character has acquired sufficient SP for the equipment's passive, they will \c[17]master\c[0] the passive.
You can view each character's \c[14]Passive Mastery\c[0] progress in the \c[17]Equip Screen\c[0].

\c[17]Turn Order\c[0] is determined by the battler's agility.

There are \c[17]8\c[0] different elements existing in the world.
The elements are oppossed to one another in pairs, and the pairings are as follows:

Fire and Water
Earth and Wind
Lightning and Ice
Holy and Darkness

Enemies may be resistant or weak to certain elements. You can use \c[17]Scan\c[0], which is a skill available to everyone, to identify and exploit these elemental weaknesses.\ndc<Battle Tutorial - Elements>
Skills of a certain element have the element's icon next to them, so you can easily identify the element of the skill.
\c[17]Leonardo\c[0] has access to Skill Types \c[17]Combat\c[0] and \c[17]Special\c[0].
He relies heavily on dealing as much damage as possible.
He possesses very high \c[14]Attack\c[0] stat and a respectable \c[30]Magic Attack\c[0] stat, but his Defenses, especially his low \c[30]Magic Defence\c[0], need to be carefully managed.
Some skills do not cost the character their turn to execute.
These skills have a icon over them.
You may use as many \c[17]Instant Cast Skills\c[0] on your turn as necessary, though they do have cooldowns, and overusing them could very quickly drain your \c[1]MP\c[0].
You may have noticed the gauge on the bottom left corner of the battle screen.
That gauge is the \c[17]Party Limit Gauge\c[0]! The gauge is shared with all members of the party, and it increases whenever the party \c[17]takes or deals\c[0] damage.
The gauge is carried over through battles, so you can use random encounters to build it up.
The gauge is required for various actions, such as...
\c[14]Break Skills\c[0] are extremely powerful skills that require the \c[17]Party Limit Gauge\c[0] to use.
Although powerful, they may take up a huge portion of the gauge, so use them wisely!
More uses of the \c[17]Party Limit Gauge\c[0] will be explained when they become available.

battle, you can change your equipment mid-battle through the

You can only change equipment once per turn for each character, and consumes \c[17]a quarter of a limit gauge\c[0], so if you do decide to change equipment mid-battle, make sure you make a sound decision!\ndc<Battle Tutorial - Equipment>
Each enemy is categorised into one or multiple \c[17]classes\c[0]:
You can view an enemy's class by \c[17]Scanning\c[0] them.
Your characters \c[17]Capability\c[0] stat towards each type determines your proficiency against each enemy class.
The \c[17]higher your Capability vs a certain enemy class\c[0], the \c[17]more damage you deal to that enemy class\c[0] and the \c[17]less damage you take from that enemy class\c[0].
Your character's capability towards each enemy class can be viewed in the \c[17]Status\c[0] screen of the Main Menu, along with other stats.
Damn. It's so difficult to hit these things.
Why did you even try hitting a \c[17]Flying Enemy\c[0] with a \c[14]Physical Basic Attack\c[0]?
Why did you even try hitting a \c[17]Flying Enemy\c[0] with a \c[14]Combat Skill\c[0]?
Trying to hit \c[17]Flying Enemies\c[0] with a \c[14]Physical Basic Attack\c[0] or a \c[14]Combat Skill\c[0] is going to yield the same result as trying
to hit them with an \c[20]Earth Skill\c[0].
They're just going to fly away...
So how am I supposed to do anything?
Just try hitting them with a \c[14]Special Skill\c[0]. They can't really dodge those.
Buying or selling goods at shops earns you \c[1]Shop Experience\c[0].
If you earn enough shop experience, you will gain a \c[1]Shop Level\c[0].
Your shop level indicates how loyal a customer you are.
Higher shop levels will earn you greater trust from the shop keeper,
offering you \c[11]discounts\c[0] on items and allow you to purchase more items from the store.
You can also gain exclusive level up rewards for getting a new shop level.\ndc<Tutorial - Shop>
Shop levels apply to and are shared by both equipment and item shops.

Your shop level indicates how loyal a customer you are.
Higher shop levels will earn you greater trust from the shop keeper,
offering you \c[11]discounts\c[0] on items and allow you to purchase more items from the store.
